result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan A Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence credit for 65 days were granted if revoked.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Bail applied to fine.  Paid in full.   Remainder of bail to be applied to 15CF562.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for New Berlin Police Department.  Bail applied to costs.  Paid in full.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  sign medical Release for Agent.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Disclose to any physician in writing your drug history/dependency signed by your physician and provide a copy to your Agent.  No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription.  Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel.

DNA Surcharge waived.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber with non-working hours with standard release conditions - To Commence FORTHWITH.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ryan A Scott in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended criminal complaint and information.  Charge is amended to a 4th offense OWI making this charge a felony.  Attorney Masnica accepts amended criminal complaint and waives formal reading.  Case bound over for trial.  Information received and formal reading waived.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Defendant pleads guilty to amended count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Counts #2 and 3 are dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Masnica makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.
The Court Orders the Following: Count #1. 
Imposed and Stayed  Sentence of 
4 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 65 days if revoked)
2 Years of Initial Confinement
2 Years of Extended Supervision

Term of Probation: 2 Years
Conditions of Probation:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
Inform agent of all prescriptions;
Sign Medical Release for Agent;
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain/Obtain full time employment;
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge
Disclose to any physician in writing your drug history/dependency signed by your physician and provide a copy to your Agent. 
No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctors prescription


Condition Time: 200 days Huber with NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence forthwith.
FINE: $1882.00 Bail to be applied
DNA Surcharge: Waived.
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to New Berlin Police Department, bail to be applied
DL REVOCATION:  24 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 24 months.
Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel 
If revoked:
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Remainder of bail ordered to be applied towards cashbail in 15CF562.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-02-2015 10:30 am

Case 15CF410 called for a motion hearing regarding the search.  Cases 15CF562 and 15CM614 called as a hearing.  Defendant Ryan A Scott in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Officer Bradley Condon sworn in, testified. Officer Chelsea Koenen sworn in, testified.  Defendant sworn in, testified.  Testimony closed.  Parties give closing arguments.  Court grants the motion to suppress the evidence in 15CF410.  Attorney Masnica moves to dismiss counts #1 and 2 in case # 15CF410.  Court denies this request.  All cases are set for a plea and sentencing.  Whatever case does not proceed to a pleah will be set for a jury trial.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.
